text: Bottle at Pers Almost gone tasting, March 2017. Dark mahogany with a light brown head that mostly fades to a thin ring. Really nice interaction between all the ingredients with a light peat, oak, bourbon, vanilla, smoky malts, maple sap, light molasses, toffee, boozy, full body that is lovely to sip and let develop. Mild carbonation, lots going on here, little too sweet but things seems to cut it somewhat.

My Bottom Line:
Deep raisiny caramel malts leap from the Barrel-Aged Barley Wine, drawing instant sherry connotations onto a quickly seduced palate.

Further Personal Perceptions:
-A ring of foam crowns the purplish brown.
-Alcohol warmth is present throughout.
-Mouthfeel is luxurious, even with the very low carbonation.
-Maple smoke is subtle, but adds even more depth.
-This is a mesmerizing sipper for malt and barrel-aging lovers.

Bottle.

A brown ale with a thin light mocha head. In aroma, nice caramel malt with light vinous notes, treacle, light bourbon barrel notes, woody notes, alcohol warmth, very nice. In mouth, a nice sweet caramel malt with light maple notes, alcohol warmth, light licorice and bourbon barrel notes, excellent. Bottle at Pers Almost gone tasting, March 2017.

Bottled at Ottawa gathering.  Hazy mahogany colour, no head. Maple syrup and caramel up front. Sweet with full body and dense, rounded mouthfeel. Treacle, mild smoke, honey. Peppery warming finish with some bitterness.

bottle stored at home. 
Smokier than I remember the base beer being when it was fresh (though I just had the draught version). Smoke and muddled malt, with a prevelant alcohol taste and nose. Still good, but likely past its prime.

Bottle thanks to baumj. Shared among friends on the 4th. Pours cloudy mahogany, small beige head, minimal lacing. Aroma is bourbon forward for sure. No smoke present, but loads of dark fruits, raisins, prunes, hints of maple, toffee. Flavor is similar, still no smoke, less fruit and maple, more vanilla, bourbon, cocoa, toffee. Fully sweet, light bitter. Full body, soft creamy mouthfeel. Good stuff.

Found a 2011 in my cellar. Maybe I waited too long but the taste was over-the-top Smokey and a lingering bitter. The looks and nose where a perfect 10 but then came The Taste :-( it didnt really have much except for the bacon smoke, bitter!

750 ml bottle ordered from the brewery and picked up in February 2013, now aged for almost three years ($30.00). Pours a deep reddish mahogany hue with one finger of fizzing cola-like beige foam that quickly recedes. Rich AROMA of dark chocolate, bourbon, still a bit of smoke, sweet maple-glazed caramels, and some booze. Glad that I opened this in mid-December as it the nose does really remind me of Christmas. FLAVOR of overly sweet toffee, boozy bourbon, maple syrup, honey / thick mead, dark sticky candied fruit, and a hint of smoky malts. Finishes sweet and with a booziness that is actually pretty nice. As with the original non-BA version, this is really sweet and comes to close to cloying, though the nice complexity in the flavors helps the situation...still, would be better if the sweetness were toned down some. Overall, nice complexity and melding of the flavors (the BA and age significantly improves it over the original)...and somehow fits in excellently here at Christmastime. (80, 993)

Pours a dark chesnut brown color with mahogany/plum edges and a one finger off-white head that quickly settles into a thin, lasting ring. Spotty lace left behind. 

Slightly smokey aroma with a prominent barrel presence yet it doesnt interfere with smoke, barleywine and sweet maple notes. Dry oak/toothpick with burnt sugar and subtle bourbon along with leathery malts, smoke, toffee, caramel and dark fruit. A bit of vanilla and coconut from the barrel along with charcoal, liquid smoke, fig, raisin, plum and date.

On the fuller end of medium body with a strong barrel presence thats nicely integrated into the barleywine notes. Damp oak, strong vanilla bean and toasted coconuts with decent bourbon flavor thats not overpoweringly hot or boozy. Spicy bourbon, vanilla and coconut followed by leathery malt, boozy sweetness, maple syrup, subtle smoke, date, fig, raisin and plum. Nice integration but still has prominent barrel and barleywine flavor. Smoke is a bit tame and there is some heat but the high ABV is well masked making this beer decently drinkable. A complex and flavorful barrel aged beer that doesnt hammer you over the head with bourbon. I enjoyed this beer and am looking forward to my other bottles.

Bottle, I think sent to me by Shane. Thanks!

A: Light mahogany color with an off-white head.

N: Maple syrup, caramel, vanilla, coconut, smoke, marshmallow, toffee, and more char. 

T: Sweet and bitter in big but restrained proportions.

M: Oily medium-heavy body, alcohol is dangerously hidden, carbonation is prickly.

O: Amazing beer. Burly and potent on the one hand, but subtle and drinkable underneath.

750 ml bottle shared by Luke. Pours a hazy orange color with a large white beige head. A big sugary hot bourbon nose. The flavor is hot shots of whiskey, sweet maple, bourbon, big sugary sweet malty base. Strawberry. Toffee. Pretty awesome.

Bottle thanks to somebody. Cant remember. Pour is murky reddish brown. Minimal head. Nose is bacon and booze. Taste is pretty decadent. Very smooth but with a noticeable boost. Taste is moderate bacon, sweet, slight maple sweetness. Damn good.

Bottle thanks to Jen. Pours a dark brown with small beige head that diminishes to nothing. The aroma is strong booze, caramel malt, burnt sugar. Medium mouth with brown sugar malt, caramel, boozey, very nice, really enjoyed this one.

Maple brown pour with light residual off white head. Nose is pure malt bomb with caramel and light vanilla. Not getting any smoke or much maple syrup. Taste follows the nose and is pretty damn good an well balanced. Alesmith never sucks. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Bottle split at Bruces pad - for the last time, big thanks to Scopester, 27/03/15.
Hazed chestnut brown with a decent beige covering.
Nose is toffee fudge, spice, wooded notes, rich caramel, subtle BA booze notes.
Taste comprises bourbon licks, toffee fudge, light chocolate, spice, caramel, wooded notes, dark fruit rinds.
Full bodied, fine carbonation, warming alcohol in the close.
Solid BA barley wine, bitterness tempers the sweet levels well.
Xolid.
user_location: Hazlemere, the lower Xhitlerns, Buckinghamshire, ENGLAND

text: 27th March 2015Swan Song at Bruces. Thanks to Paul. Hazy deep amber beer, good pale tan head. Sweet malts and toffee on the nose. Dry palate, good fine carbonation. Bitterish caramel malts. Touch of wood. Spicy warming bourbon dominates. Dry finish. Bitter spicy bourbon linger. The basis of a good beer but it is a bit fierce and still needs more time.

Bottle share, thanks to Bruce. Reddy brown, lightly sparkling, small ring of tan head. Aroma is vanilla, varnish, coconut, buttery. Body is medium, foamy, low carbonation. Taste is dry up front, sweet and boozey, twiggy, some toffee maybe. Quite different to the base beer - particularly the smell.

Bottle shared in London - many thanks to Bruce. Pours lightly hazy amber with a foamy tan head. The nose has some butterscotch, toasty bread, grains, brown sugar. Big sweet flavor with tasty ripe fruits, toffee, slight earthy bitterness, caramel, vanilla. Full bodied, lightly chewy with fine carbonation. Warming finish with gooey ripe fruits, more caramel, bread, fruitcake. Excellent.

Bottle thanks to Bruce. It pours hazy deep brown with a small beige head. The nose is sweet, juicy, big vanilla, bourbon, toffee, maple, dried fruits, candied fruits and toasty brown sugar. The taste is sweet, punchy, bittersweet, earthy, toffee, booze, wood, bourbon, leather, toasty cake and vanilla with a dry, warming finish. Full body and fine carbonation. A bit boozy on the taste. Might need a bit more time to smooth out. Still very nice.

Thanks to mcberko for sharing this. Ruby/garnet pour. No head. Aroma: huge and boozy. So so hot, but nice. Maple, bandaid, caramel, toffee, fruits (like apricot and stuff). Taste: boozy as fuck. So damned hot. Smoke comes through. Sweet and intense. The maple sweetness + bandaid smokiness doesnt combine well for my tastes, but if it wasnt for my personal hangups I could see how you could love this beer.

I was fortunate to try this rarity at a recent Seattle tasting. Unfortunately, Im getting less and less tolerant of big sweet boozy BA beers. This has a rich brown pour with mild head, quite attractive really. But the flavors--a mix of bourbon and sweet sugar with maple and maybe a hint of smoke. Ill be the lowest rating by far, but it really wasnt doing it for me and Im going to stay true to my tasting notes.
whalesmith does it again. Perfect barrel aging. Sweet and incedible complex barrel characteristics. Phenomenal stuff.

Sample at the Uber-Kurt (10,000) Celebration on 12/13/2014. The beer is a clear dark copper color with a medium off-white head that diminishes steadily to a film. Patchy lacing on the glass. Aroma of bourbon, dark fruit and maple syrup. Full-bodied with an oaky bourbon character and notes of sweet maple and smoked malt as well as dark fruits. The finish is boozy with a bourbon and dark fruit aftertaste. Good beer all around.
Bottle @ another tasting. Aroma is huge caramel, molasses, syrup, vanilla, oak, light hint of smoke. Awesome. Flavour is creamy malty light roasty nutty vanilla oak bourbon etcetera. LRAB.
Bottle at a Seattle tasting. Smoke, maple, BW. Gorgeous deep mahogany, lovely maple sweet. Caramel sweet BW. Barrel is great. Terrific beer

750mL bottle, pours a deep dark amber with a small beige head. Nose brings out light smoke, bourbon barrels, and a touch of maple. Flavour brings out nice smoky notes, with medium bourbon notes, and some alcohol heat, though I bet its mellowed out since bottling. Very well-designed - the barrel aging makes this even more complex. Excellent slow sipper.
Bottle - sweet caramel and wood. Clear copper with. Small white head. Caramel, light barrel and bourbon notes and Woody finish. Nice and balanced, well done.

From a bottle (75 cl), courtesy of _angst_. CLear copper, tiny beige head. Bready and bisquity malts, piney and citric hops, pretty strong barrel aromas, a bit boozy. Semi dry, medium bitterness, some tannins.

Bottle received in trade. Thank you heatwaves! Pours dark born with a small goldenish beige head that doesnt leave much trace while dissipating. Smell is sweet and malty with caramel, toffee, charred wood, smoke, charred wood, bourbon alcohol, hay, soil and alcohol. Taste is sweet, malty and tiny smokey with caramel, toffee, charred wood, smoked charcuteries, moist soil, hay and bourbon alcohol. Mouthfeel is soft, round, tiny viscous, slightly boozy and medium to full bodied. Finish is tiny sweet, bitter and malty with caramel, toffee, smoked meats, moist soil, charred wood, bourbon alcohol and lemon zest. Nice smokey malt bomb

Bottle at An afternoon of Skulls, Scotsman and Speedway 141129. Clear deep amber beer with a nice beige head. Malty caramel aroma, toffee, raisins, figs, banana notes, prunes, wheat notes, raisins, some toffee. Caramel flavor, raisins, banana, figs, prunes, vanilla, some toffee. Sweet and delicious.

(Bottle) Pours reddish brown with a nougat coloured head. The aroma holds clean bourbon, caramel, smoke, alcohol and woodsy/earthy hops. The flavour is near medium sweet, medium bitter and tiny acidic. Caramel, smoke, barrel tones and, as usual, balanced hops. The mouthfeel is round and light numbing with a soft carbonation. Alcohol and bourbon on the finish. Near full bodied.

November 26, 2014 - bottle via trade. Brown pour with limited head that faded quickly. Aroma was just fantastic - smoke, maple, caramel and bourbon. Taste started with the sweetness (maple, vanilla, caramel), moved to a light smokiness and finished with a nice bourbon.

Bottle at another tasting. Clear copper pour with thin straw head. Aroma is really smooth, tons of Alesmith malt, maple, molasses, vanilla, nice bourbon notes. Taste is so rich and decadent, nice caramel vanilla bourbon, tons of maple, not much smoke, nice sweet flavors. Palate is rich, mouth coating, great sipper. Awesome.

Bottle @ Another Tasting, courtesy of Vaiz. Massive thnx for sharing this one! Pours hazy dark amber colour with a medium sized off white head on top. Aroma of big caramel malts, loads of barrel, vanilla, big bourbon characters.
Flavor is very sweet, light alcoholic, big boozy characters. The malt base is very big on this one, loads of sweet stuff going on. Amazing well balanced beer. Age is incredible. Great stuff!!

Bottle at Another Tasting, hosted by MrHangover. Clear copper pour, thin off-white head. Aroma full of bourbon, maple syrup, some aged hops and slightly warming booze. Flavor is very smooth, loads of bourbon, sugary malts, boozy and warming. Amazing balance and very delicate intense malts. Fantastic brew.

Bottle shared at Another Tasting thanks to Vaiz. Pours dark brown with a tan head. Aroma of bourbon, vanilla, wood, maple syrup and light overripe dark fruits. Flavor is moderate to heavy sweet and light moderate bitter. Maple dominating the palate with soft bourbon barrel. Full bodied with soft carbonation.

Light touch of smoke in this and comes together with some florals and lots of candied malt. A touch on the burnt side. Pours reddish brown with ok lacing. Finishes a little sweet, a little bitter. Some prune and raisin. Bottle pour at Churchkeys 5th anniversary.
Poured a dark amber color with aromas of bourbon, light smoke, some maple, dark fruits, and caramel. flavors follow suit, thanks to the kind person who shared this gem with me.

Bottle... This beer rocks! Mostly clear longhorn-orange ale with a small, creamy, white head. Toasted coconut and gooey caramel are front-and-center in the bouquet. Full-bodied and velvety with vibrant carbonation. The flavor presents layers of bourbon and caramel and loads of liquor warmth. Finishes boozy and bittersweet, then fairly dry. Muchos kudos to richiesd for shipping this bad boy my way!
HMOG 2014. Pours a hazy dark amber. Scent is grainy and sweet. Starts spicy and sweet and finishes earthy. Medium body with middling carbonation. Bottle - Shared at 2014 HMOG

Bottle, thanks to Jeff sharing. Pours a hazy copper brown with a small head that lingers a bit. Aroma is somewhat dominated by the bourbon but theres also some dark cherry, caramel, toffee, and a touch of smoke. Taste has a ton of oaky bourbon. Some light sweet toffee and dark fruit creeps through a little. Light smoke and the dry, boozy finish. A tad harsh but this is really pack with flavor. Would really like to try the non BA version.

Bottle: Thanks, Jeff! More AleSmith is always appreciated! Muddled brown body with thin, copper edges. Even a fairly hard pour doesnt yield much foam on top. Aroma has dark, dried fruit covered in a molasses, toffee, & bourbon bath. I wasnt getting maple at first, but the latter half of each whiff is full of sweet maple syrup... It takes another few minutes of warming up to pull some faint sweet smoke on the front end, too. Not much wood in the aroma. Taste has notes of sweet caramel malt, raisins, vinous dark fruits, light anise, heavy maple syrup, boozy toffee, & light cocoa powder in the finish. The flavor didnt have much smoke to it, but the maple syrup & wood were certainly there, especially in the finish. Huge, thick, sticky body, expected for the style. A very nice barrel-aged beer from AleSmith, though this one is BIG. Drinks even bigger than 11% ABV. Be sure to tackle this with multiple people, as its truly a beast.

Courtesy of northernbrews
Bottle: The aroma consists of caramel, toffee, fruit, and a touch of smoke. It pours a hazy orangish-brown with a small off-white head that quickly fades to a thin film. The flavor starts with caramel, toffee, and vanilla. The finish light smoke, coconut, and light bourbon. Its medium-full bodied with a slightly sticky mouthfeel.

23 feb 2014, bottle. Nose is sweet oatmeal raisin cookies. Med body and mildly fizzy. Sweet oatmeal cookies and big raisins. Great!

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Bottle: &nbsp Deep dark dirty caramel, thin frothy off-white head, spotty lacing. &nbsp Alcohol right up front, then rich breadiness, lots of caramel, and a bit of smokiness. &nbsp Seems rich and sweet. &nbsp Strong breadiness up front, loads of caramel, followed by a rich biscuity background, followed by some strong warming and a touch of smoke. &nbsp Smoke comes across as a touch of campfire with smoked meat. &nbsp Does have a slight Maple aspect to it. &nbsp Remains alcoholic from front to back. &nbsp Feels a bit rough, but at the same time, after 2 years it still could stand to mellow out. &nbsp Moderate to full body and mouthfeel. &nbsp Lingering smoke, charred wood, campfire, smoked meat, biscuit, caramel malts, maple syrup, with a touch of salt and of course, bourbon. &nbsp The bourbon aspect really comes out at the finish. &nbsp Pretty damn tasty.

Big thanks to Sparky for sharing. This 750mL pours with a nice looking murky deep copper body that supports a thin tan head. The aroma offers up a blended smooth mixture of dark fruity esters, other vague fruity notes and then running into malty sweet rich bourbon and booze. Nice. The taste is smooth and rich and subtly vibrant at the same time. It starts with bourbon booze mingling with sweet malt smothered prunes with some maple syrup tossed in for good measure. It gets even more rich and warming as the finish approaches. Great stuff.

Bottle. Pours cloudy deep amber color with a khaki head. Aroma is rich bourbon, vanilla, marshmallow and smoke. Taste is sweet with a little alcohol burn on the the tongue. Sticky texture and carbonation on the tongue. Nicely put together and balanced between smoke and sweetness of the base beer and bourbon treatment. Really good.

Bottle, 12/13/2013. Pours brown, ruby highlights with off-white head which fades rather quickly. Aroma is caramel, vanilla coconut, sweeter maple notes blending nicely with smoke, boozy bourbon, spicy licorice. Taste is rich vanilla, touch of maple rounding out smooth bourbon, creamy caramel notes, lots of oak, subtle smoke in the aftertaste. Thick, though closer to medium body, a nice sipper. Very complex, another great treat from AleSmith.

Location/Date:Bottle split with Dave and Harris on 11/15/2013.
Appearance: Pours a cloudy maroon.
Aroma: Aroma smoke and maple.
Taste: Faint bitterness, light smoke, light bourbon, caramel.
Palate:Medium body, lingering finish.
Summary: I really enjoyed this version. As always Im a fan of smoked beers, this did not disappoint - it is slightly smoky, which explains why my smoke beer hating friends also enjoyed it.

On tap @ Alesmith. Pours dark caramel brown with a thin mocha head. Aroma is bold caramel, maple syrup, faint smoke, oak and vanilla. Taste is caramel, sweet malt, booze and light smoke in the finish. BIg full bodied balanced beer. Great Barley Wine!
Bottle. Dark brown with a fizzy tan head. Caramel, molasses, chocolate, sweet grain, bourbon, oak, and light smoke aroma and taste. Thick sticky full bodied palate.

Thanks Jen for bringing this out .. . Pours a fathomed plum .. Strong foam .. . Mild smoke, lots of maple .. . Everything about this beer is awesome .. . . Who opens a bottle of beer while stretching their arms straight out 2 feet?

Rating #1400. 750 ml foil-capped bottle, thanks to a trade with Alen. Barrel aged aromas hit me from two feet away after I pry off the cap--toasted coconut, vanilla, bourbon; also raisins, molasses. Maple comes out strong after it warms. Pours murky brown with a medium beige head that falls into a collar after a minute or two. Taste is sweet and oaky before becoming savory and boozy. The booze, although strong, is welcome here and not overbearing. Finishes with a licorice flavor. Body is thick and chewy, texture syrupy. I dont get any smoke at all here, which I was really looking forward to, but this is still pretty freaking awesome.

750 ml. bottle, shared with Poisoneddwarf- Pours muddy brown with an off white head that reduce to a collar almost immediately. Aroma is strong oak and bourbon, vanilla and cherries, maple opens up as it warms. The taste is so smooth, velvety vanilla, maple, oak, bourbon. Body is surprisingly light for the style, which is medium, carbonation is soft. Very good beer, if not excellent, this is the type of barleywine that I love.
Aroma is flatter than I imagined. Pours a typical brown hue for a barley wine. Pretty distinct and unique taste and palate for a barley wine. Very evenly balanced notes of bourbon.

Bottle @ a recent bottle share... Poured deep, dense, brownish-dark orange with a moderate head. This was great! Nice barrel notes with oak and whiskey that worked extremely well with smoked undertones and maple sweetness. Hints of vanilla sweetness and dark fruits made this seem like the perfect after dinner beverage.

Taster from a bottle shared at Natifest 2013. Hazy orange amber color. Chunks of sediment visible in the body (mine was the last pour from the bottle). Minimal khaki head, some bits of lace. Awesome big bourbon vanilla flavor, moderate sweet taste. Light bit of alcohol warmth. Bigger body. Smooth, creamy light carbonation. Lightly dry finish. Awesome stuff.

750ml bottle. Thanks to Tom most definitely... Pours a medium two shades paler than cola with lesser intense edges while topped with a wispy shy of beige head... Aroma of oak and deeper caramel and toffee. Smooth vanilla and barrel throughout. A touch boozy with a light smoke aspect... Flavors are more caramel and barrel and toffee throughout. Smooth with a touch of bitter astringency. Syrup maple finish which transcends it for me being a maple fan. Bigger than medium bodied with a lighter level of carbonation.

750 ml bottle shared by Steve at Natifest- thanks again! Pours a cloudy amber with a small off-white head. The aroma has smooth bourbon throughout, with notes of caramel, toffee, oak, dates and other dark and dried fruits. Flavor has the same, with a deeper oaky, peaty, earthy character to it. Medium-bodied, with a sweet, warming mouthfeel and moderate carbonation. I wish I had the 2011 Decadence so I knew the base beer better. This is excellent.
Bottle shared at natifest. Pours a translucent copper with a beige head of foam. Aroma is big bourbon and brown sugar. Tastes of bourbon and molasses.

750ml, black foiled bottle, via trade. pours a murky, rich, rusty red capped by a thin, creamy, khaki head that leaves tight rings of lace. aroma is simply outstanding with heavy notes of sweet toffee, vanilla, toasted oak, bourbon, and maple syrup backed by hints of rum, angels food cake, dried figs, and just a hint of campfire. flavor is fantastic, certainly a bit bolder that most Alesmith barrel aged brews, but this one really works for me with heavy notes of toasted barrel, toffee, pralines, rum-raisin cake, and vanilla beans backed by maple syrup, nutty roast, bourbon, plums skins, and subtle smoke with heavy bourbon on the finish. palate is full bodied, bold, rich, and imposing without being cloying. overall, another (i say this a lot) marvelous barrel aged effort from Alesmith.
bottle. pours murky brown with solid but fast fading head. big oak and vanilla aroma. taste is very nice charred barrel and sugar and vanilla slight smokey finish

Bottle. Pours a murky rust colored brown with a quickly fading light tan head. Aroma is sweet bourbon with vanilla, light maple and some underlying heavier malt notes but the bourbon mostly dominates. Taste is bourbon, vanilla, some coconut, alcohol spice, and sweet malt/raisin with perhaps some maple. The smoke is nowhere to be found. Smooth and coating mouthfeel. Very nicely done barrel aged beer with an excellent bourbon aroma and taste but the base beer is for the most part lost underneath the bourbon.

750 ml bottle (shared with the Mrs.; BIG thanks mikem409). Looks good; a hazy amberish brown with off-white lacing. Smells good too; sweet and malty with notes of bourbon, vanilla, caramel, toffee, and maple. Tastes like it smells with a nice, smooth mouthfeel. Great beer!

Bottle courtesy of Hopscotch.  Clear amber pour with a small white head.  Maple and barrel aromas.  Huge maple, sweet caramel malts, raisins, plums, and mild wood notes.  Slight bitter finish.  Good stuff...
Bottle shared by dedollewaitor, thanks. Unclear brownish body with a medium offwhitebhead. Aroma is bourbon, dark fruit, vanilla, alcohol. Flavor is alcohol, dark fruit, vanilla, caramel, bourbon.

Bottle @ The Lost Tasting Of Abbey Beers, Odense 2013. Thanks to Sean 9689.  Pours ruby amber with a small creamy head. Sweet malty nose. A bit of dark dried fruit, massive caramel and a bit of wood. Very vague wood, smoke, mild alcohol and some liquorice. Refined and balanced. Smooth and slick. Great stuff.

Bottle @ The Lost Tasting Of Abbey Beers, Odense 2013. Hazy copper with a small off-white head. Malty aroma of caramel and brown sugar, with vanilla, coconut and bourbon. Very sweet malty flavour with caramel and dried fruit, and lots of hot alcohol

750mL thanks to t0rin0, Womencantsail, and Travlr for my wedding reception! Another big hit. Clear deep amber pour generates quite a yellow head, more dense than expected. Nose is heavy, rich bourbon, buttery barrel, maple syrup, mild seasoned tomato, black pepper, rum soaked sponge cake. Taste is spicy and sharper barrel forward like Goose Island King Henry. Almost identical barrel character to Bourbon County Stout. Mild sweet maple, pecans perhaps, no smokiness really. Still, a boss barleywine that got the thumbs up from my barleywine loving friends. Thank you!

Bottle courtesy of T0rin0 to GT2 and biggirlpanties,graciously shared at their wedding - thank you all!  Rich, velvety, complex barleywine with notes of vanilla, brandy, prunes, maple, toast. Delicious.

Bottle. Murky, copper red color with a light tan head. Caramel, toffee, dark fruit, and booze notes. Medium/heavy mouthfeel. Chewy. Lots of sweet caramel flavors upfront, and then the booze cuts through and cuts the sweetness. Little bit of spiciness too. Ends fairly cleanly. Pretty tasty. Could probably use some time to chill to cut tr booze flavors.
Amber/red pour, Aroma is killer with smokey, wood, caramel sweetness.  Taste adds some bourbon, vanilla and molasses.  Damn tasty.

Damn, I love these guys!  Popped the cap and a plume of smoke wafted out, filling my nostrils with toasted oak, rich bourbon, vanilla, caramel, toffee, and maple.  Mrs. Butterworth, Aunt Jemima, and all of Canada would be proud!  Flavor shows charred wood, molasses, freshly split vanilla bean, brown sugar, cocoa, maple, and beautiful bourbon.  The alcohol in this is present, warming as it slides down and showing on the tongue but it isnt overly distracting.  A bit of time might round this out but it is delicious now.  Syrupy texture would make an amazing addition to pancakes.  Yum!

Big ol thanks to El Capitan, Bman1113vr, for this guy. Dark orange caramel looking pour. Nose is pine, bourbon, leather, malts, maple. Flavor is caramely, leather, bourbon, plum, boozy. Great warming finish. Really a delicious beer, enjoyed this a lot. Thanks again, Andrew!

Pours semi transparent dark brown with a thick tan head. The nose is big English toffee, caramel, vanilla, raisins and molasses. The taste is heavy sweet with medium bitterness throughout. The texture is soft at first but turns sharp. The body is heavy and finish is long!  

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
bottled, thanks to bman111vr, golden orange color with no head, lots of whiskey and caramel on the nose, flavors of whiskey, smoked meat, caramel, bready waffles, nice warming finish
Aroma of caramel, vanilla bean and slight ham.  Pours hazy and brown with a sticky film.  Taste is super sweet with great butterscotch, vanilla, and just a great bbq finish.  Super delicious.

On tap and Bottle. Pours with a murky bronze hue with an off-white head that fades. Aromas are of maple, nutty, bourbon, molasses, minerals, cola, vanilla and light smoke. Rich barrel. Flavors are a bit thin and a touch musty, alcohol, nutty, cola, medium dry tannins, smokey. Medium carbonation and warming with a nice hit of bourbon barrel on the back end.

Thanks to bman1113vr for sharing this bottle. Pours a dark amber color with an off-white head. The aroma is full of maple, a light bit of smoke, bourbon, caramel and toffee. The flavor is equally delicious and equally complex. I get some smoke up front, but that quickly dissipates in favor of maple, bourbon, vanilla, oak, toffee and caramel. I also get some alcohol notes. Medium mouthfeel and medium carbonation.

Amber pour, off white head.  Aroma is killer with smoke, caramel, bourbon, oak, brown sugar, honey.  Flavor is really awesome.  I only detected one flaw, its a bit hot...maybe some time?  Bourbon, oak, smoke, vanilla, dark agave syrup.  Very tasty stuff!
I preferred the non-barrel incarnation of this one. This one has some added complexity but also added oxidation notes.

September 8th, 2011 - I believe this sample was on the list of limited edition beers that were going fast; these are the ones tucked at the bottom right of AleSmiths chalkboard. They frequently change, and thats not because AleSmith is tossing out good beer. Demand drives variety, and in this case I happened to be fortunate enough to land on a day when they were pouring Barrel Aged Old Decadence. The aroma is incredibly boozy, reflecting the time spent in the barreled penitentiary, and a dozen scents familiar to my bourbon and whiskey shelf entice my nose: caramel, sugar, apple, pineapple, pine, wood, syrup, etc. The flavor introduces an acidic dimension which plays well with the complexity of the flavors, adding white grape juice to a low a slow swirling vat of darker, sweeter flavors. In fact, this almost tastes more like an Imperial Red than it does a Barley Wine. Whatever its categorical definition, the flavor is strangely but alluringly sour, offering a delicious puckering to an ornate balance of delicious whiskey barrel-infused flavors.

Cask at Alesmith.  Slightly hazy yellowish amber pour, with a darker off-white head.  Lots of bourbon, vanilla, sweet toffee, maple syrup, still some smoke in here too, boozy, and a hint of chocolate.  Nicely done as always, Alesmith.

Opaque mahogany pour with a miniscule white head. Huge bourbon and booze aromas. Nice vanilla, maple syrup, and brown sugar. Some chocolate oxidation notes, oak, caramel, and smoke. The flavor is very sweet and very barrel forward. Tons of bourbon, vanilla, and oak. Maple syrup, brown sugar, and caramel sweetness. Some chocolate, alcohol, and a smoke flavor that becomes more prevalent as the beer warms up.

Bottle, picked up at the same time as BA Kopi; poured into a tulip.  Pours amber with medium white head.  Aroma is smoke, maple, bourbon.  Flavor is caramel, toffee, maple, booze, with an alcoholic finish.  Very smooth.

Bottle; picked up from the brewery alongside the BA Kopi Luwak Speedway. Color is dark amber with medium carbonation, capped with a small head of vanilla colored foam. Smoked malts show through in the aroma with lots of bourbon and hot alcohol. Flavor is a sweet blend of caramel, toffee, chocolate truffle and cherry, finishing bitter with an oaky barrel-aged nuance. The alcohol really takes over the finish, with a pronounced bourbon note. Give it a few more years to mellow out, still kind of hot at this point. Overall really, really tasty.

750ml bottle from brewery. Pours a murky dark brown color with a medium tan head that audibly fizzes away to a film. The aroma is dominated by the whiskey barrel aging along with some dark fruits and a bit of sherry. The flavor is similar to the nose with the whiskey in the forefront backed up nicely by lightly smokey grains, raisins, dates, and a bit of maple. The palate is full and silky smooth with lively carbonation. Finishes long and hot. Overall: Lots of hot alcohol in this one, watch out. I had to pair this with some fine cheeses (Gruyere and Jarlsberg) to cut the booze and make this enjoyable.  Id recommend aging this for a couple of years to see if it comes together a bit better.
